intro: Euphorbia pisima, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a succulent plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique sap and specialized floral structures. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are inconspicuous, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators. Euphorbia pisima is adapted to arid environments, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping.
